Streptococcal infection (e.g., scarlet fever, strep throat)
justification: Fever, cervical lymphadenopathy, and fatigue are classic symptoms. Lip cracking can be caused by dehydration from the fever.}, {diagnosis: Strep throat (Streptococcal pharyngitis)
justification: Fever, cervical lymphadenopathy, and sore throat are common symptoms. Lip cracking can be caused by dehydration from the fever.}, {diagnosis: Viral pharyngitis
justification: Similar symptoms to strep throat, but caused by a virus. Lip cracking can be caused by dehydration from the fever.}, {diagnosis: Upper respiratory infection (URI)
justification: Fever and cervical lymphadenopathy can be present. Lip cracking can be caused by dehydration from the fever or mouth breathing.}, {diagnosis: Kawasaki disease
justification: Fever, cervical lymphadenopathy, and cracked lips are all characteristic symptoms. However, it typically affects young children.}, {diagnosis: Cat scratch disease
justification: Cervical lymphadenopathy and fever are common. Lip cracking is less common but can occur.}, {diagnosis: Dental abscess
justification: Can cause fever, cervical lymphadenopathy, and lip cracking. Pyuria is less likely but may occur with systemic infection.}, {diagnosis: Urinary tract infection (UTI)
justification: Pyuria and fever are common symptoms. Cervical lymphadenopathy and lip cracking are less common but can occur.}, {diagnosis: Autoimmune disorders (e.g., lupus, Sjogrens syndrome)

justification: Can cause a wide range of symptoms including fever, cervical lymphadenopathy, and dry, cracked lips. Pyuria is less common but can occur with kidney involvement.}, {diagnosis: Medications side effects

justification: Certain medications can cause a wide range of side effects, including fever, lymphadenopathy, and dry mouth (leading to lip cracking). Pyuria could be unrelated or indicate a drug-induced kidney injury.}
